required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Identifying Atopic Dermatitis Patients at Risk for Developing Conjunctivitis During Dupilumab Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Identifying Atopic Dermatitis Patients at Risk for Developing Conjunctivitis During Dupilumab Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: Study on ophthalmological comorbidities and the underlying pathomechanisms of conjunctivitis during dupilumab treatment in atopic dermatitis (AD) patients. Patients participate in the Bioday Registry.

primary_outcome.measure: Relationship between goblet cell density and the incidence of conjunctivitis over time
primary_outcome.time_frame: change of goblet cell density between baseline, 4 weeks and 28 weeks after start dupilumab, at the moment of the development of eye symptoms, 4 weeks after ocular treatment
primary_outcome.description: Establish the relationship between goblet cell densitiy and the incidence of conjunctivitis during dupilumab treatment in AD patients. Goblet cell density will determined by counting the goblet cells. The amount of goblet cells will be compared at different time points. Goblet cells will be collected using Impression Cytology of the conjunctiva and will be stained directly.

primary_outcome.measure: Relationship between goblet cell density and the risk of conjunctivitis
primary_outcome.time_frame: change of goblet cell density between baseline, 4 weeks and 28 weeks after start dupilumab, at the moment of the development of eye symptoms, 4 weeks after ocular treatment
primary_outcome.description: Establish the relationship between goblet cell densitiy and the risk of conjunctivitis during dupilumab treatment in AD patients. Goblet cell density will determined by counting the goblet cells. The amount of goblet cells will be compared at different time points. Goblet cells will be collected using Impression Cytology of the conjunctiva and will be stained directly.

secondary_outcome.measure: Conjunctival changes during dupilumab treatment using Impression Cytology
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 4 weeks and 28 weeks after start dupilumab, at the moment of the development of eye symptoms, 4 weeks after ocular treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Better understanding of conjunctival changes using Impression Cytology of the conjunctiva, collected at different time points during treatment with dupilumab in AD patients

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the moment of the development of eye symptoms, 4 weeks after ocular treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Establish the most optimal treatment of conjunctivitis during dupilumab treatment. Ophthalmological examination will be compared at all time points to determine if the prescribed therapy is effective and optimal.

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood, tear fluid, impression cytology of the conjunctiva

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients with atopic dermatitis indicated for dupilumab, without current use of oral immunosuppressive treatment .

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients with atopic dermatitis indicated for dupilumab, without current use of oral immunosuppressive treatment .
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with oral or ocular immunosuppressive drugs 2 weeks prior to start of dupilumab treatment

contact.last_name: M S de Bruin-Weller, MD, PhD

investigator.last_name: M S de Bruin-Weller, MD, PhD
